pullRequest.title: Shading often corrupts non-code metadata in META-INF/MANIFEST.mf

commit.message:
Shading often corrupts non-code metadata in META-INF/MANIFEST.mf

@suztomo Inspired by https://github.com/googleapis/gax-java/issues/1207

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              for every jar.
          
          
            
              for every JAR file.
          
      
    
    
  

https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/deployment/jar/basicsindex.html
"JAR" for the files. "jar" for the command.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -22,7 +22,8 @@ There are a number of problems with shading:
   to also roll in the security fix).
 - Shading cannot be performed on types used in a library's own public API as return
   types or method arguments.
-- Service entries under `META-INF/services` can easily be messed up. They need
+- Shading often corrupts non-code metadata in META-INF/MANIFEST.mf and other locations.
+  For instance, service entries under `META-INF/services` can easily need
   special effort to be merged because the entries are located in the same place
   for every jar.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            - Shading often corrupts non-code metadata in META-INF/MANIFEST.mf and other locations.
          
          
            
            - Shading often corrupts non-code metadata in META-INF/MANIFEST.mf and other files.
          
      
    
    
  

I think you meant "files in other locations." This is the same as "other files".

nodes.bodyText: (minor) Not every JAR file has META-INF/services.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -22,9 +22,10 @@ There are a number of problems with shading:
   to also roll in the security fix).
 - Shading cannot be performed on types used in a library's own public API as return
   types or method arguments.
-- Service entries under `META-INF/services` can easily be messed up. They need
-  special effort to be merged because the entries are located in the same place
-  for every jar.
+- Shading often corrupts non-code metadata in META-INF/MANIFEST.mf and other locations.
+  For instance, service entries under `META-INF/services` are hard 
+  to merge because the entries are located in the same place
+  for every JAR file.
